definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: As the recession deepens, Barbie’s conservative values are also back in vogue.
sentences.chinese: 隨經濟蕭條惡化，芭比娃娃的保守價值也重振雄風。

sentences.english: History says that banks bounce back from legal problems.
sentences.chinese: 回顧歷史，大多銀行能從法律糾紛中重振雄風。

sentences.english: When will the Chinese women's volleyball team experience a revival?
sentences.chinese: 中國女排何時能重振雄風？

sentences.english: At age seventy, 73% of men are still potent.
sentences.chinese: 73%的男人在七十歲時仍然雄風不減。

sentences.english: One of the keys to regain its splendour and fascination is to embrace life tightly.
sentences.chinese: 而重振雄風的關注之一是緊緊擁抱生活。

sentences.english: Clarion call for reform and opening up Gudang Treasures from the Orient.
sentences.chinese: 改革開放的號角鼓盪起東方的雄風。

sentences.english: Despite 600 years of wind and rain erosion, the wall still looks as grand and majestic.
sentences.chinese: 城牆歷經了600餘年的風雨滄桑，至今仍雄風猶存。

sentences.english: Tiger with the king of beasts, the penis and bearing a proudly.
sentences.chinese: 虎以百獸之王著稱，有着傲然的雄風與氣度。

definition: fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to talk idly about important matters (idiom)/to set the world to rights/to pass judgment on everything
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
